page.title: 03NAIRN:ACHAREIDH
page.content: Achareidh is the biggest housing estate in Nairn and the houses are fairly new compared with the other housing estates in Nairn. The estate got its name because it was built in a large field and was the name of the local farm. Achareidh is Gaelic for large field. Most of the houses were built from 1972_1974. Just over 90% of the houses are detatched and only a few are semi_ detatched.Most of the houses have 9 rooms,but a big proportion have 5 and 6 rooms.The average household has 4 people in a family ,but there are a few pensioners and young couples. Of the people we surveyed,most people in our area go to karate & swimming for a hobby,but a lot of elderly women do knitting.
